item.title: Why the Future of the Movies Lives on Letterboxd
item.description: The entertainment industry is in crisis, but a social platform for film enthusiasts is thriving. Is it changing the way we watch?

item.title: My Neighbors Are Running an Auto Shop in Their Driveway. What Should I Do?
item.description: I’m afraid that even a code violation could draw attention from ICE.

item.title: Trump’s Immigration Policy Is 100 Years Old
item.description: The White House seems to be mining the Coolidge era for inspiration. But America is not the country it was in 1924.

item.title: Can You Use the Ocean as a Bathroom?
item.description: A ruling on a timeless dispute.

item.title: Michael Pollan Says Humanity Is About to Undergo a Revolutionary Change
item.description: The best-selling author grapples with big questions about A.I., consciousness and the distractions polluting our minds.

item.title: My Cousin Is About to Become Homeless. How Much Should I Give Up for Him?
item.description: I’ve eaten PB&Js for 35 years in an effort to have a retirement where I can do what I want.

item.title: When Grief Came for the Gravedigger
item.description: In pursuit of an interesting life, he came face to face with death.

item.title: Can I Cut Ties With a Friend Who Helped Me Through a Hard Time?
item.description: As I recovered from my heartbreak, I started to notice he had some views that I couldn’t disagree with more.

item.title: Does Your Wife Have to Buy Groceries That Disgust Her?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over deli-case tuna salad.

item.title: My First Child Has a Genetic Syndrome. Can I Use I.V.F. to Spare My Second?
item.description: With such a small risk of illness, does this type of embryo selection border on eugenics?

item.title: Inside a Detention Site at the Heart of Europe’s Harsh New Approach to Immigration
item.description: This former military barracks in Bulgaria has become a symbol of the E.U.’s increasingly strict policing of its borders — and of what may come next.

item.title: What It Means to Be a White ‘Race Traitor’
item.description: From Schwerner and Goodman to Good and Pretti, white people putting themselves in harm’s way has helped galvanize Americans for justice.

item.title: Key Moments in Gisèle Pelicot’s Interview With The Times
item.description: The woman at the center of France’s largest-ever mass-rape trial told us about her life before, during and after the abuse she suffered at the hands of her husband.

item.title: ‘They All Tried to Break Me’: Gisèle Pelicot Shares Her Story
item.description: In her first interview with an American media outlet, Pelicot opens up about surviving years of secret abuse — and a trial that shocked the world.
